definition: to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: The fourth chapter focuses on the collection of votes, and the integration of paper-based books.
sentences.chinese: 第四章着重論述藏書票與紙質書籍的一體化。

sentences.english: Some people reserve them for a fancy bookplate .
sentences.chinese: 有些人將它們留作貼花哨的藏書票用。

sentences.english: Chapter III analyzed the history books ticket changes in features and functions.
sentences.chinese: 第三章分析藏書票的歷史特徵和功能轉變。

sentences.english: Joined in Chinese Exlibris Research Institute, China Artists Society (2008). Executive member of Chinese Exlibris Research Institute, China Artists Society.
sentences.chinese: 現爲中國美術家協會藏書票研究會常務理事。

sentences.english: Some parents even recommend bookplates or custom bookplates.
sentences.chinese: 有些父母甚至推薦使用或者製作藏書票。

sentences.english: JPG file of bookplate can be downloaded and printed on your choice of labels.
sentences.chinese: 藏書票圖片檔可供下載，並印刷在您喜愛的標籤紙上。

sentences.english: The fifth chapter analysed the book collection ticket design in books overall design ponder.
sentences.chinese: 第五章分析藏書票設計在書籍整體設計中的思考。

definition: with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
(Tw) (publishing) belly band (paper sash around a book, outside the dust jacket)
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
felt-tip pen/roller ball pen/gel ink pen
